metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15074 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: OpenVPN Access Server older than version 2.8.4 and version 2.9.5 generates new user authentication tokens instead of reusing exiting tokens on reconnect making it possible to circumvent the initial token expiry timestamp.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> OpenVPN Access Server is not based on the open-source openvpn code.

criterions.comment: openvpn: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
